bug.author: khazit
bug.summary: Large images don't render in Chrome
bug.description:
Describe the bug Large images (in this case 20000 x 20000) don't render in Chrome, but they do in Edge. I don't know if it's an issue on the browser side or on LS side, but maybe this behavior should be documented somewhere as I spent quit a bit of time thinking that something was wrong with my configuration. To Reproduce Import large images Expected behavior Images should render on both browsers
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43420058/87284800-136b8080-c4f7-11ea-9ead-52c5c3a3494b.png></denchmark-link>
Using Google Chrome <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43420058/87284850-20886f80-c4f7-11ea-8c21-014b43e963f6.png></denchmark-link>
Using Edge Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: Windows Browser: Chrome and Edge Version: Chrome 83

comments.comment: Can you send us any huge image which has this behavior? But it seems the problem is in browser.

You're right <denchmark-link:https://github.com/makseq>@makseq</denchmark-link> . It was an image format problem, not related to the size : Chrome doesn't support TIFF. <denchmark-link:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_web_browsers#Image_format_support>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_web_browsers#Image_format_support</denchmark-link>
Thanks for you help ! I'm closing this issue.
